pageProps.contentHtml:
conformal mappings

Find a conformal map of the domain

D={z∈C∣∣z−1∣<2, ∣z+1∣<2}D = \set{z \in \C \mid \abs{z - 1} < \sqrt{2},\ \abs{z + 1} < \sqrt{2}}D={z∈C∣∣z−1∣<2​, ∣z+1∣<2​}

onto the open unit disc centered at the origin. It suffices to write this map as a composition of explicit conformal maps.
Solution.

DDD is the unit of two circles which intersect at iii and −i-i−i at an angle of π2\frac{\pi}{2}2π​. First, we translate so one of the intersection points is at the origin:

φ1 ⁣:D→Ω1=D+i,φ1(z)=z+i.\func{\phi_1}{D}{\Omega_1 = D + i}, \quad \phi_1\p{z} = z + i.φ1​:D→Ω1​=D+i,φ1​(z)=z+i.

Next, we send the other intersection point 2i2i2i to ∞\infty∞ in a symmetric way. More specifically, we want 0↦00 \mapsto 00↦0, i↦ii \mapsto ii↦i, and 2i↦∞2i \mapsto \infty2i↦∞, so we get

φ2 ⁣:Ω1→Ω2,φ2(z)=iz2i−z.\func{\phi_2}{\Omega_1}{\Omega_2}, \quad \phi_2\p{z} = \frac{iz}{2i - z}.φ2​:Ω1​→Ω2​,φ2​(z)=2i−ziz​.

Observe that

φ2(z)=iz(−2i−z‾)∣2i−z∣2=2z−i∣z∣2∣2i−z∣2=2Re⁡z∣2i−z∣2+i(2Im⁡z−∣z∣2∣2i−z∣2).\phi_2\p{z} = \frac{iz\p{-2i - \conj{z}}}{\abs{2i - z}^2} = \frac{2z - i\abs{z}^2}{\abs{2i - z}^2} = \frac{2\Re{z}}{\abs{2i - z}^2} + i\p{\frac{2\Im{z} - \abs{z}^2}{\abs{2i - z}^2}}.φ2​(z)=∣2i−z∣2iz(−2i−z)​=∣2i−z∣22z−i∣z∣2​=∣2i−z∣22Rez​+i(∣2i−z∣22Imz−∣z∣2​).

In other words, because D+iD + iD+i was symmetric about Re⁡z=0\Re{z} = 0Rez=0, it follows that Ω2\Omega_2Ω2​ is also symmetric about Re⁡z=0\Re{z} = 0Rez=0. Since angles are preserved by conformal mappings, we see that the circles are mapped to half-lines containing 000 which intersect at an angle of π2\frac{\pi}{2}2π​. Again by symmetry, we see that Ω2={π4<Arg⁡z<3π4}\Omega_2 = \set{\frac{\pi}{4} < \Arg{z} < \frac{3\pi}{4}}Ω2​={4π​<Argz<43π​}, where we take the standard branch (0,2π)\p{0, 2\pi}(0,2π). After the rotation

φ3 ⁣:Ω2→Ω3={0<Arg⁡z<π2},φ3(z)=e−iπ/4z,\func{\phi_3}{\Omega_2}{\Omega_3 = \set{0 < \Arg{z} < \frac{\pi}{2}}}, \quad \phi_3\p{z} = e^{-i\pi/4}z,φ3​:Ω2​→Ω3​={0<Argz<2π​},φ3​(z)=e−iπ/4z,

we get the first quadrant. Thus, we can complete the problem with

φ4 ⁣:Ω3→Ω4=H,φ4(z)=z2φ5 ⁣:Ω4→Ω5=D,φ5(z)=z−iz+i,\begin{aligned} \func{\phi_4&}{\Omega_3}{\Omega_4 = \H}, \quad &&\phi_4\p{z} = z^2 \\ \func{\phi_5&}{\Omega_4}{\Omega_5 = \D}, \quad &&\phi_5\p{z} = \frac{z - i}{z + i}, \end{aligned}φ4​φ5​​:Ω3​→Ω4​=H,:Ω4​→Ω5​=D,​​φ4​(z)=z2φ5​(z)=z+iz−i​,​

so the desired conformal mapping is φ5∘⋯∘φ1\phi_5 \circ \cdots \circ \phi_1φ5​∘⋯∘φ1​.
